message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and their application in document analysis, specifically word spotting in handwritten documents. This falls under the computer vision domain, which is covered by the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of weak supervision and synthetic data generation, which are techniques commonly used in information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV, followed by cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, and cs.AI.
